intro: Erigeron porsildii, commonly known as Porsild's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Erigeron porsildii is often found in alpine tundra and is a valuable component of its ecosystem.
